iaik.security.cipher

Class GCMParameterSpec

  • java.lang.Object
    • iaik.security.cipher.GCMParameterSpec
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec

    public class GCMParameterSpec
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec
    GCM (Galois/Counter mode) parameter specification.

    This class holds the necessary inputs (additional data, nonce, MAC length or MAC block) for the encryption and decryption with the GCM mode.

    If no parameters are passed to the constructor the IV is generated and the macLength is set to 12. If only macLength shall be specified, nonce and additional data have to be null.

    Version:
    File Revision 2
    See Also:
    AlgorithmParameterSpec

      Creates a GCM Parameter specification with the given additional data and nonce.
      GCMParameterSpec(byte[] aaData, byte[] nonce, byte[] macBlock)
      Creates a GCM Parameter specification with the given additional data, nonce and MAC block.
      GCMParameterSpec(byte[] aaData, byte[] nonce, int macLen)
      Creates a GCM Parameter specification with the given additional data, nonce and MAC length.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns the associated data used for authentication.
      byte[] getMac()
      Returns the authentication block used to authenticate the plaintext and additional data.

      Returns the number of bytes used for the MAC block.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GCMParameterSpec

        public GCMParameterSpec(byte[] aaData,
                byte[] nonce,
                int macLen)
                 throws java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Creates a GCM Parameter specification with the given additional data, nonce and MAC length. This constructor shall be used to specify algorithm parameters for encryption. The MAC block is null. (No MAC block must be specified for encryption.)
        Parameters:
        aaData - the additional data that is authenticated
        nonce - bytes used to generate the IV
        macLen - number of bytes used as MAC
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException

      • GCMParameterSpec

        public GCMParameterSpec(byte[] aaData,
                byte[] nonce,
                byte[] macBlock)
                 throws java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Creates a GCM Parameter specification with the given additional data, nonce and MAC block. This constructor shall be used to specify the algorithm parameters for decryption. Nonce and MAC block must be set for decryption.
        Parameters:
        aaData - the additional data that is authenticated
        nonce - bytes used to generate the IV
        macBlock - the MAC block used to verify authenticity
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException

      • GCMParameterSpec

        public GCMParameterSpec(byte[] aaData,
                byte[] nonce)
                 throws java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Creates a GCM Parameter specification with the given additional data and nonce. MAC length will be set to 12 bytes.
        Parameters:
        aaData - the additional data that is authenticated
        nonce - bytes used to generate the IV
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException

      • GCMParameterSpec

        public GCMParameterSpec()
                 throws java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Creates a GCM Parameter specification with default values. The nonce will be generated and the MAC length will be set to 12 bytes.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
